fields.title: Ancient Passwords
fields.content: The idea of passwords isn't just a digital age phenomenon. Ancient Romans used passwords as a way to convey messages among the military.

fields.title: First Computer Password
fields.content: The Compatible Time-Sharing System (CTSS) at MIT, which came into existence in the 1960s, is credited with the implementation of the first computer password.

fields.title: Common Passwords
fields.content: Despite security risks, many people still use easily guessable passwords like "123456", "password", or "admin".

fields.title: Average Number
fields.content: According to a report by NordPass in 2019, an average internet user has around 70-80 passwords.

fields.title: Breaches
fields.content: In many data breaches, passwords are often the primary target for cybercriminals.

fields.title: Reuse
fields.content: About 65% of people reuse the same password for multiple accounts, increasing vulnerability.

fields.title: Password Lifespan
fields.content: The average lifespan of a password, i.e., the time before it’s changed, is around 90 days for most businesses.

fields.title: Two-Factor Explosion
fields.content: Two-factor authentication saw a significant rise post-2010, making accounts more secure than using just a password.

fields.title: Password Managers
fields.content: By 2020, more than 60% of businesses were using a password manager to help employees manage their security.

fields.title: Biometrics
fields.content: Companies like Apple and Samsung have increasingly integrated biometric security, indicating a potential shift away from traditional passwords in the future.
